_meta.purpose: HYPOTHETICAL - Tactical options for amendments and modifications in COMM_EVT phase
_meta.note: This is a hypothetical/placeholder artifact. It represents what would be generated by draft_amendment_strategy_comm_evt agent in COMM_EVT phase after committee_referral is confirmed.

assumptions: System has advanced to COMM_EVT phase
Committee referral external event has been confirmed
Draft Legislative Language has been generated
scenario.purpose: Demonstrate structure and content of amendment strategy artifact

strategic_overview.primary_objective: Defend core policy intent while accommodating necessary modifications
strategic_overview.flexibility_principle: Accept technical and clarifying amendments; resist substantive changes that alter policy intent
strategic_overview.coalition_management: Coordinate with allies to defend against adverse amendments
strategic_overview.opposition_mitigation: Pre-empt opposition amendments through proactive framing

technical_corrections.rationale: Improve clarity and accuracy without altering policy intent
technical_corrections.response_strategy: Support or propose proactively to demonstrate flexibility

examples: Additional findings to strengthen policy rationale
clarifying_amendments.rationale: Strengthen policy without changing core mechanisms
clarifying_amendments.response_strategy: Evaluate on case-by-case basis, generally supportive

enhancement_amendments.rationale: May improve policy if they don't create excessive burden
enhancement_amendments.response_strategy: Negotiate to ensure amendments don't create implementation barriers

examples: Amendments that alter core policy mechanisms
substantive_changes.rationale: Would fundamentally alter approved policy direction
substantive_changes.response_strategy: Oppose through coalition coordination, alternative language proposals

examples: Amendments designed to kill the bill
poison_pill_amendments.rationale: Designed to undermine or kill the legislation
poison_pill_amendments.response_strategy: Strong opposition, coalition mobilization, alternative proposals

examples: Amendments that create committee jurisdiction conflicts
Language that conflicts with existing law
jurisdictional_conflicts.response_strategy: Point out procedural/legal issues, propose compliant alternatives

proactive_amendments.rationale: Demonstrate flexibility and control the amendment process
examples: Technical corrections identified in legal review
Clarifying language to address anticipated questions
proactive_amendments.timing: Before committee markup, coordinate with committee staff

defensive_amendments.strategy: Prepare alternative language for anticipated adverse amendments
defensive_amendments.rationale: Offer acceptable alternatives to block or modify unacceptable amendments
examples: Alternative language that addresses concerns without altering intent
defensive_amendments.coordination: Coordinate with allies to ensure support for alternatives

coalition_coordination.strategy: Coordinate with allies to defend against adverse amendments
coalition_coordination.rationale: Unified coalition response is more effective than individual defense
tactics: Pre-markup coalition meeting to align on amendment positions
Designated coalition members to speak against adverse amendments
Whip count of committee members on key amendment votes

opposition_engagement.strategy: Engage with opposition to understand concerns and pre-empt amendments
opposition_engagement.rationale: Understanding opposition concerns may allow pre-emptive addressing
approach: Staff-level discussions to understand specific concerns
Identify areas where policy can accommodate concerns without altering intent
Propose acceptable modifications before opposition proposes adverse amendments
opposition_engagement.risk: May reveal strategic positions, use with caution

key_votes.amendment_concerns: May support technical amendments, oppose substantive changes
key_votes.engagement_approach: Emphasize policy benefits, address specific concerns

tracking_categories.status: Amendments that have been formally proposed
Amendments that are anticipated but not yet proposed
Amendments that were proposed but defeated

tracking_categories.response_required: Document impact, adjust strategy if needed

amendment_risks.risk: Substantive amendment that alters policy intent
amendment_risks.mitigation: Coalition coordination, alternative language proposals, strong opposition

amendment_risks.risk: Poison pill amendment designed to kill bill
amendment_risks.mitigation: Early detection, coalition mobilization, procedural objections

amendment_risks.risk: Multiple amendments that collectively alter policy
amendment_risks.mitigation: Track cumulative impact, coordinate defense across amendments

risk_assessment.mitigation_overview: Proactive engagement, coalition coordination, alternative language preparation

required_artifacts.usage: Base language to defend and modify
Committee member context and engagement strategy
